description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 By the end of 2019, about 200 parliamentarians and parliamentary staff in Southeast Asia have increased capacity in legislative and democratic development in the region. The capacity of parliamentarians in Southeast Asia to engage constructively in the legislative process will be strengthened through the provision of research products which follow standard practices for parliamentary research services globally and the provision of regional exchange. The regional activities will comprise trainings for regional fellows on parliamentary research, English, legal analysis, legislative drafting, parliamentary communications, public policy evaluation, parliamentary budget analysis, regional comparatives studies, regional information exchange network, and seminars. The parliaments with well-equipped knowledge will be better respond to the constituents’ needs and local reality. Capacity building will eventually lead to a better sharing of power, an improved management of conflicting interests and effective systems of checks and balances as key elements for enhanced governance.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 I slutet av 2019, förväntas cirka 200 parlamentariker och parlamentarisk personal i Sydostasien ha ökad kapacitet i lagstiftnings- och demokratisk utveckling. Kapaciteten hos parlamentariker i Sydostasien att engagera sig på ett konstruktivt sätt i lagstiftningsprocessen kommer att förstärkas genom tillhandahållande av forskningsprodukter som följer standardmetoder för parlamentarisk forskning globalt och genom regionalt utbyte. De regionala aktiviteterna kommer att omfatta utbildningar inom parlamentarisk forskning, engelska, juridisk analys, lagberedning, riksdagskommunikation, utvärdering, parlamentariska budgetanalys, regionala jämförelsetal, regionalt informationsutbyte samt nätverk och seminarier. Mer välutrustade med kunskap kommer parlamenten bli bättre svara på behov från den lokala verkligheten. Kapacitetsuppbyggnad förväntas så småningom att leda till en bättre fördelning av makt, en förbättrad hantering av motstridiga intressen och effektiva system för maktfördelning som nyckelfaktorer för ökad styrning.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative: In the time of pandemic, PIC training and workshop programs have been shifted online. There were some activities to be highlighted in 2020 as followed: The General Assembly of the ASEAN Inter-Parliamentary Assembly (AIPA) was held virtually from 8 to 10 September 2020. As the AIPA Member Parliaments adopted to renew the MoU between AIPA and PIC on “Capacity development program for staff of the ASEAN Inter-Parliamentary Assembly Member Parliaments” during the 40th General Assembly of AIPA in Bangkok in 2019, PIC was invited to attend the 2020 General Assembly to provide the update of their activities. Fitting well with the theme, the PIC capacity building program on parliamentary diplomacy, delivered to members of staff from participating AIPA Member Parliaments, were shared to the conference. The virtual Training Seminar on Parliamentary Responsibilities was finalized on 6 November 2020. 48 participants have been awarded a certificate of completion and participation. This seminar served as a platform for the exchange of knowledge and sharing of best practices on the three core functions of the Parliament: legislation, representation and oversight. Key takeaways include: appreciating the diverse structure of parliamentary systems and its practices; ways to bridge the gap between the parliament and its citizens through the representation function; and tools used by Parliaments to provide checks and balances on the government. Another point of discussion was parliamentary diplomacy, a valuable tool to strengthen international relations within the ASEAN region and beyond. An online training workshop on “Parliamentary Committee Work”, was held from 16 to 18 November. This virtual training workshop’s topics mainly focused on the functions and types of committees in different parliaments, the practical work of parliamentary committees and the work of parliamentary staff to support them. The “Regional Training of Trainers Program”, an online workshop was hosted from 30 November to 4 December 2020, delivered in cooperation with the University of Sussex Department of Education. The participants were staff from ASEAN Inter-parliamentary Assembly (AIPA) Member Parliaments, including Myanmar, Cambodia, the Philippines and Thailand. The main objectives of the training were to improve the quality of individual and institutional pedagogic skills, and to examine the challenges and opportunities of training design. It is important to note that at the time of writing, the PIC annual report for 2020 is not due yet. More results can be reported after April 2021.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
